item.title: Rumor: Call of Duty 2025 Could Receive Major Battle Pass Changes
item.description:
Summary

  • Call of Duty 2025 is rumored to introduce Limited Time Modes tied to Battle Pass ownership.
  • Higher-tier skins, loot, and crossover Operators from LTMs may be exclusive to Battle Pass holders in the new 2025 installment.
  • Potential changes to the reward system in Call of Duty 2025 could urge players to invest more time and money.

A well-known Call of Duty leaker shares details about several major changes that could be coming to the Battle Pass system in the 2025 installment of the franchise. If the rumor is true, this would mark the second time Call of Duty 's Battle Pass has undergone a significant overhaul.

Originally, Call of Duty used a DLC system where players could purchase paid content packs – typically released in four waves per game – that included maps, weapons, and cosmetic items. With the rise of Fortnite and its Battle Pass system's widespread success, Call of Duty adopted a similar approach for both its premium and free-to-play titles. This system lets players earn cosmetic and consumable rewards by gaining XP through gameplay. It includes a free track and a premium track, which requires CoD Points to unlock. So far, the only major change to the system has been the shift from tier-based progression to a page-based format.

Well-known Call of Duty leaker TheGhostOfHope recently shared on Twitter that Activision, the publisher of the franchise, and Treyarch, the expected developer of the upcoming 2025 title, plan to make significant changes to the Battle Pass system. According to the post, the new system introduces “more seasonal LTMs,” some of which are described as “higher value,” featuring unique rewards and new game mechanics or modes. The key difference is that access to these limited-time modes would be restricted to players who purchase the Battle Pass. Currently, all players can access special Call of Duty LTMs and additional game content for free without needing to buy the Battle Pass.

Call of Duty 2025 Could Require Battle Pass Ownership to Access In-Game Content

In a follow-up paragraph, the leaker reported that plans are allegedly in motion to make “higher-tier skins, loot, and crossover Operators for LTMs” available exclusively through Battle Pass purchases – replacing the “Premium Event Track” model currently used in Black Ops 6 during mid-season updates. If true, this shift would restrict certain premium content to Battle Pass owners only, requiring players to buy the pass to unlock and enjoy these items. This marks a departure from the current system in Black Ops 6 , where most content is accessible to all players, with the Battle Pass offering additional consumables and cosmetics as optional extras.

Changes to reward systems in Call of Duty are common, as monetization plays a central role in encouraging players to invest both time and money. Over the years, Call of Duty has adjusted its own reward system to offer greater incentives, and if the rumors about upcoming changes in Call of Duty 2025 are true, the community’s response will be key in determining whether the system needs to be re-evaluated. Given details regarding CoD 2025 haven't been officially confirmed yet, the information should be taken with caution as things can always change during development.

Forced to go rogue. Hunted from within. This is Call of Duty: Black Ops 6.

Developed by Treyarch and Raven, Black Ops 6 is a spy action thriller set in the early 90s, a period of transition and upheaval in global politics, characterized by the end of the Cold War and the rise of the United States as a single superpower. With a mind-bending narrative, and unbound by the rules of engagement, this is signature Black Ops.

The Black Ops 6 Campaign provides dynamic moment-to-moment gameplay that includes a variety of play spaces with blockbuster set pieces and action-packed moments, high-stakes heists, and cloak-and-dagger spy activity.

In a best-in-class Multiplayer experience, players will test their skills across 16 new maps at launch, including 12 core 6v6 maps and 4 Strike maps that can be played 2v2 or 6v6.

Black Ops 6 also marks the epic return of Round-Based Zombies, the fan-favorite mode where players will take down hordes of the undead in two brand-new maps at launch. Post-launch, players can look forward to even more exciting maps and groundbreaking experiences dropping into both Multiplayer and Zombies.

item.title: How Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Humanizes Its Dialogue
item.description:
Good dialogue is precious in any creative medium, but perhaps even more so in games. Whether it's in combat barks, banter with teammates, or even the use of internal monologues, the ability to effectively establish a character's voice is much easier said than done. Endearing players to their motivations is one part of the task, but there's also the consideration of how to retain attention; when cutscenes are all too often skipped or overlooked in favor of gameplay, a strong hook is more important than ever to keep engagement high, and the perfect way to do so is to treat dialogue as humanly as possible. That's just what Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 manages to do.

Humanizing dialogue seems like such an obvious thing, but the nuances of how people talk are myriad; sometimes people trip over their words, or stutter, or repeat themselves. Consider that in the world that Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 establishes, and there's even more reason for dialogue that leans into these inconsistencies. Speech isn't going to be perfectly polished at a moment when two lovers say goodbye, or as two survivors lay against a mass of corpses comprised of their fallen friends. Clair Obscur 's prologue is riddled with moments like these, showing that dialogue doesn't always have to be "perfect" to be effective.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33's Dialogue is a Testament to the Power of Subtlety

A Host of Personalities

Clair Obscur 's opening immediately impresses with the sheer range of its personalities. The people of Lumiere, like in real-life, hold different perspectives; in the tumult of the Gommage, it makes sense for its citizens to be sad or angry, content or maligned, because despite them all sharing the experience of the Paintress, that doesn't mean that they'll cope in the same ways. That's why the actual Expedition of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is such a powerful and interesting plot device, because even in the nobleness of its characters dedicating what's left of their lives to trying to enact change, there are still some that see it as dangerous and irresponsible, a waste of talent or resources. A suicide mission.

Speaking From the Soul

When Sophie and Gustave reconcile just before her Gommage, they stumble over their words. When she dissolves into petals, they hold hands and briefly speak; he says he's here, and she says she knows. That's all that is needed at that moment; no overly drawn-out professions of love or goodbyes. When the festival of the expeditioners occurs later that day, some grieve with drink, while others, like Lune, pore themselves into their work before the departure. It's yet another demonstration of how even the smallest of side characters get humanized. Though they might be new faces to the player, to Gustave, they could be life-long friends, and that's an important distinction made in their interactions, further highlighting Lumiere's dwindling society.

In the weight of arriving on the main continent, the ability of Clair Obscur to effectively portray shock is commendable. Characters aren't infallible, and Gustave isn't a war hero. It takes Lune snapping him out of his trance-like state to form words, and even then he still stumbles over his dialogue. Later, when the two argue over the dangers of going to seek out Maelle, they actively speak over each other. Dialogue flows naturally, words inflect with emotion, and Clair Obscur 's voice actors show the power of not just their deliveries, but the good writing that they have to work with.

What Exists Outside the Player's Purview

The game's camp interactions are another indicator of Clair Obscur 's dialogue leaning on the natural, even if it doesn't necessarily factor into the player's knowledge. When Lune brings up Gustave having lost his arm, for example, she doesn't awkwardly fit in how he lost it, as we can surmise that she already knows. The same holds true for when Gustave and Sciel have their first camp interaction, as the two reminisce on Gustave and Sophie's closeness and their efforts back in Lumiere to help. Characters talk like they actually know each other, not needing to compromise on the player's behalf, thus showing the power of subtlety and context clues to make dialogue even more compelling.

10 Images
10 Images

item.title: Henk Rogers Gives His Thoughts on Tetris Clones
item.description:
For many who were born in the 70s and 80s, video games will forever be linked to the image of playing Tetris on the Nintendo Game Boy. The game has maintained its global popularity even today, with countless modern updates keeping it firmly in the public eye. The fact it can be used to improve memory, or even as a way to deal with trauma, has helped to ensure it continues to find a new audience as well as still satisfy its existing one.

During Gamescom LATAM, Game Rant sat down with The Tetris Company's co-founder Henk Rogers. He gave his thoughts on the ever-changing industry and Tetris ' enduring popularity. He also opened up on how he felt about the many Tetris clones that have popped up over the years.

Henk Rogers on Copying Games

Perhaps unsurprisingly, Tetris ' popularity has spawned many copycat games over the years. Rogers is fully aware that, on the one hand, this should be seen as a compliment, and shows that Tetris was a pioneer and the first of its kind. However, he is also under no illusion that many of these clones can reflect poorly on their creators, who he feels would be better placed to put their time and creativity into more unique ventures. He explained,

''When somebody copies the game, one way of looking at it is that it's flattery. I'm flattered that they're doing this. But the second thing I'm thinking is, if you want to make money, if you want to get somewhere, don't copy somebody else's game. That's not art. You haven't created anything, so it's like being a cover band. That's a good comparison. You know you can do better than that.''

Successful Tetris Clones are Dealt With Appropriately

Occasionally, a Tetris clone may become financially successful. When this happens, Rogers and his colleagues act swiftly to ensure their intellectual property is protected. Given the size and scale of The Tetris Company compared to the companies behind some of these clones, it doesn't usually take long to nullify such a threat. Rogers continued,

''Basically, if they make money, we'll definitely step on them. That's how it works. In order to have an intellectual property, you have to protect it. We've gone back and crushed some wannabes when we needed to. So now it's kind of quiet. You don't see any major company coming up with a 'me too' Tetris . There are just a lot of little guys.''

This ruthlessness shows just how protective Rogers is of the Tetris brand. His recent book, The Perfect Game , expands on the movie that was released a few years ago, and highlights the journey that both he and Tetris ' creator Alexey Pajitnov went on in order to ensure Tetris turned into the global success that it eventually did. The franchise has endured for more than 40 years and Rogers doesn't see this changing any time soon.

item.title: Star Wars: The Old Republic Players Can Get Double XP and Free Droid Pet
item.description:
Summary

  • Star Wars: The Old Republic offers double XP, a B25-SAL Probe Droid, and more for Star Wars Day 2025.
  • The 16-day event also includes 50% off Collections unlocks.
  • Promotional sales and freebies help make this year's Star Wars Day celebrations particularly noteworthy.

Star Wars: The Old Republic players can earn double XP, get a free droid mini-pet, and more for a limited time. It's been a big weekend for Star Wars fans, with many games and stores running themed promotions to celebrate May the 4th, and the franchise's long-running MMO is no exception. Anyone who logs into Star Wars: The Old Republic over the next couple of weeks can get a good deal of in-game freebies.

While Star Wars Day rolls around every year, this year's round of sales and giveaways has seemed particularly noteworthy. Epic and Steam are both running major discounts, a new collection of classic games from the franchise has come out, and two of Prime Gaming's 22 free games for May 2025 are Star Wars titles, with a few additional ones being available to stream for Luna Plus subscribers. Amid the wave of promos, it's only natural that The Old Republic would join in the celebration.

On May 1, Broadsword announced its plans for Star Wars Day 2025, which include double XP for all users and a 50% sale on Collections unlocks. The promotion began that same day and will run until May 16, 2025, giving players a couple of weeks to take advantage of all the giveaways and discounts. In addition to the XP boost and Collections sale, SWTOR is giving away the B25-SAL Probe as a mini-pet droid to anyone who logs in during that timeframe. Promotional shots of the floating, spinning droid show off The Old Republic' s ongoing graphical updates, which include some noticeably more detailed textures than older builds of the nearly 14-year-old MMO.

All Star Wars: The Old Republic Star Wars Day 2025 Promotions

  • 50% Collections Unlock Sale
  • All Inspired By items on the Cartel Market will be 25-75% off
  • Double XP Event
  • Log in and receive an exclusive B25-SAL Probe Droid Mini-Pet

The 16-day promotion is one of the longer-lasting Star Wars Day deals available this year. That's fitting, considering how The Old Republic remains the longest Star Wars game to this day, giving players over 500 hours of content if they try to experience everything the continually updated MMO has to offer. Getting twice the XP for two weeks is particularly noteworthy, especially for anyone trying to level up without much grinding.

Since Broadsword took over The Old Republic from BioWare, the game has received plenty of content updates, promos, and graphical upgrades. Despite being over a decade old, it seems like the title still has plenty of life left in it, and deals like this Star Wars Day celebration certainly help keep it going.

STAR WARS™: The Old Republic™ is the only massively multiplayer online game with a Free-to-Play option that puts you at the center of your own story-driven STAR WARS™ saga. Play as a Jedi, a Sith, a Bounty Hunter, or as one of many other iconic STAR WARS roles and explore the galaxy far, far away over three thousand years before the classic films. With 6 narrative expansions, become the hero of your own STAR WARS adventure as you choose your path down the Light or Dark side of the Force™.

Create your legacy. Make meaningful choices throughout your journey and become the hero of your personal STAR WARS saga. The game includes an interactive storyline with cinematic dialogue and full voiceover for all in-game characters.

A growing world awaits. For more than 10 years, players have been able to live out their own STAR WARS stories. With the most recent Onslaught expansion, STAR WARS: The Old Republic continues to deliver ongoing content through regular updates.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero Leak Shows Gacha Animations for Version 2.0 Characters
item.description:
Summary

  • Zenless Zone Zero leaks are showing off the gacha animations for the three new characters coming in the game's Version 2.0 update.
  • The debut of Zenless Zone Zero's Season 2 will introduce Yixuan, Pan Yinhu, and Ju Fufu as the first members of the game's Yunkui Summit faction.
  • The update will also introduce the Waifei Peninsula as the newest explorable area in New Eridu, alongside a new management mini-game and a rumored Mahjong mini-game.

A recent leak from Honkai: Star Rail is showing off the gacha animations for the game's trio of new characters in the Version 2.0 update. The next patch for the HoYoverse urban action RPG is set to be one of the game's biggest updates yet, with lots of new content on the way. Version 2.0 will introduce a brand-new district to New Eridu with the addition of the Waifei Peninsula, said to be a more "free roam"-oriented area with Chinese-themed aesthetics. Now, more details about the update's cast of characters is being teased.

Zenless Zone Zero 's Version 2.0 update will add three brand-new characters to the roster, bringing a new faction and a new class to the game. Yixuan is expected to be Version 2.0's lone S-Rank unit, with both her in-game Attribute and Specialty expected to be entirely new. Pan Yinhu and Ju Fufu will also join the roster during Version 2.0 as A-Rank characters, debuting as a Physical Defense character and Fire Stun character, respectively. A new leak is now showing off each new character's gacha animation.

Zenless Zone Zero Leaks Teases Version 2.0 Gacha Animations

A recent video shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker Mero shows off the gacha animations for Version 2.0's three new characters. The post shows the default poses for Yixuan, Pan Yinhu, and Ju Fufu, while teasing other visual elements of the gacha screens for the Yunkui Summit characters. The showcase also includes the individual visuals on the TVs for each character, with Yixuan's featuring a Bangboo, Pan Yinhu's TV showing a camera, and Ju Fufu's depicting a bowl of food. Zenless Zone Zero 's Version 2.0 update is expected to release on June 4.

Zenless Zone Zero 's next update is rumored to feature a variety of content beyond its playable characters. The update will see the release of the first act of the urban action RPG's next story arc, with the Proxies traveling to Waifei Peninsula and starring both Yunkui Summit and the OBOL Squad. Zenless Zone Zero 's Version 2.0 is also expected to include a new management-style mini-game, and is even rumored to be adding a new Mahjong mini-game within Waifei Peninsula.

While fans eagerly await the launch of Zenless Zone Zero 's "Season 2," the game's ongoing update is gearing up to welcome one of its most highly-anticipated characters. Version 1.7's second half will welcome S-Rank Ice character Hugo to the roster, previously featuring in Lycaon's Agent Story, Version 1.5's flagship event, and even as an in-game boss. The update's second half will also introduce Hugo's Bangboo companion Robin as the newest S-Rank Bangboo on the gacha banner. Hugo's release will serve as a precursor to one of Zenless Zone Zero 's most exciting updates yet.
